Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ultrasound-Guided Stellate Ganglion Blockade in Thoracoscopic Pulmonary Lobectomy

Participants.evidence: patients aged 18-75 undergoing elective thoracoscopic pulmonary lobectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either SGB (n=40) or standard care (n=39)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the potential of ultrasound-guided stellate ganglion blockade (SGB) to mitigate these complications.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in oxygenation index (OI) and pulmonary shunt fraction (Qs/Qt) during SLV, measured at multiple time points.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: SGB significantly improved OI and reduced Qs/Qt compared to controls.

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported, with mild complications occurring in 3% of the SGB group and 1% of the control group.
